subject: Re: [junit] unit test results, ant and junitreport task
msgSnippet: ... Yes. There are two things: 1. Adding more information to the XML test results that Ant produces. 2. Adding more to the XSL stylesheet Ant uses to turn the
messageBody:
ilkin ulas Balkanay wrote:

> Hi, i am using junit task in my build.xml to execute my unit tests and
> then i use junitreport to generate html reports from unit test results.
> I want to see unit tests execution date, cvs tag for the executed tests
> in the html reports generated by junitreport. Is there a way to
> customize the junitreport task output?

Yes. There are two things:

1. Adding more information to the XML test results that Ant produces.
2. Adding more to the XSL stylesheet Ant uses to turn the XML into HTML.

You can learn about both in Chapter 7 of _JUnit Recipes_.

--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
